restaurant.name: Steel City Sandwich
restaurant.short_description:
Pittsburgh is a blue collar town built on the hard labor of steel workers. When the Great  hit, they had to work even longer hours just to make ends meet.  With twenty hour work days and only twenty minute lunch breaks, the workers needed a delicious and filling meal before going back to work, but lacked the time to sit down and eat a full meal of protein, vegetables, and potatoes. Out of this desire, the Pittsburgh-style sandwich was born. 

The sandwich shops started serving slaw and fries on the sandwich. This way the steel workers could have a quick, tasty, satisfying meal to get them through the rest of their shift.  Still to this day Pittsburgh sandwiches are made this way and are a staple of the Pittsburgh community. 

Why are Steel City Sandwiches so yummy? They're comfort food. There's no fancy mayo, buttered buns, or truffle oil. They don't need 'em! Fresh ingredients prepared properly taste great all on their own. We get our Italian bread fresh daily from Vito at Eagle Rock Bakery. 
We don't toast 'em or butter 'em cause they're fresh and perfect for holding overloaded sandwiches. 
The coleslaw is shredded daily and wilted with sugar and vinegar for over an hour to get that perfect vinegary slaw taste. 
The fries are hand cut, blanched to get that starchy taste out, and then cooked again at a higher temperature to get that perfect crispiness. Just a little salt and pepper and those fries are good to go. Three simple ingredients treated properly are the foundation for the perfect Steel City Sandwich.

restaurant.name: Pressed Juicery
restaurant.short_description:
Pressed Juicery offers individual bottled juices as well as nutritional juice cleansing programs, which will give your system the break it needs to regenerate and heal itself from the inside out.

We aim to make your detox experience interactive and fun, by personalizing coolers of juice straight to your doorstep. 

PRESSED JUICERY was born out of the idea that in order to find fulfillment and balance each day, modern people need to be armed with a fresh set of tools that are simple, convenient, and tailored to their hectic schedules. 

We believe that everyone is entitled to live their best lives, but in order for this to happen, we need to get back to our roots. While the benefits of juicing are endless, we aim to cut through the confusion and condescension of so many health trends and get to the point: our bodies require vital nutrients to function at their optimal levels, and the quickest and most natural way to get them is through fresh juice. While that is not a revolutionary concept, it seems that with every step we’ve taken towards making the world more connected, we have some how lost sight of the basics. 

At PRESSED, we want you to have it all. Our juices are made with organic ingredients and are pressed daily, and personalized to your lifestyle, providing you with the option to hop online and order individual bottles or a cleanse, straight to your doorstep as often as you’d like. Life gets complicated, but at the end of the day all of your goals are possible if you have a finely-tuned vehicle to help you accomplish them. So, let us do the work, while you enjoy the ride.

restaurant.name: The Pudding Truck
restaurant.short_description: The Pudding Truck is the first gourmet food truck in Los Angeles to serve decadent, old-school stove top pudding and artisan toppings. Founder Carrie Cohen first conceived of the idea during a brief stint as an entertainment industry assistant when she realized that her favorite part of the job was bringing in homemade treats for her coworkers. Made with all organic dairy and humanely harvested cage-free eggs, our pudding is hand whisked to rich and creamy perfection in small batches, utilizing the best ingredients we can find. All of our pudding is naturally gluten-free, and seasonal vegan options are a constant presence on the rotating menu. We look forward to seeing you at your upcoming events and on the streets!

restaurant.name: Mandoline Grill
restaurant.short_description:
Mandoline Grill started with the simple promise to bring delicious Vietnamese food to Los Angeles.

Owner, Mong Skillman, incorporates both traditional and vegan options into the menu. The flavor and family history is passed down through her mother's tasty recipes, who also owns and operates Sông Hương restaurant in Honolulu, Hawaii.

In the fall of 2009, Mandoline Grill launched at the Verdugo Bar in Glassell Park. For these first few months, Mong supplied her own fryers, toaster oven, and coolers, basically throwing a backyard cookout at the beloved Eastside bar. As support grew, Mong started riding shotgun and working shifts on the Dosa Truck, just to get a hang of the food truck life before hitting the streets in her own truck this past February 2010.

Now Mong has the privilege of introducing her mother’s inspirational flavors to LA (and beyond!) as she drives the Mandoline Grill truck from Orange County to Echo Park to Santa Monica, offering fresh, crisp vegan and carnivore-friendly bánh mì sandwiches, and of course, her mother’s famous bún thịt nướng noodle bowls.

We are pleased to offer you a taste of Vietnam with a splash of Aloha!

Cousins is considered one of the best. They have been voted the number three lobster roll in the nation and were awarded the 2012 and 2013 number one food truck in LA by the Los Angeles Hotlist. restaurant.name: Chunk-N-Chip
restaurant.short_description:
Chunk-N-Chip is a family owned business that creates smiles & seasonal Craft Ice Cream Sammiches®: oven-warmed, ooey gooey cookies served with honest-to-good ice cream – YUMM! We are a small-batch business with a soft spot for fresh, simple, premium ingredients (locally sourced when possible). No artificial whatchamacallits or mass production here. Just old school craftsmanship and a ton of love! 

Our craft cookies and honest to good ice cream are handmade in small batches only with simple, real ingredients. Like good old-fashioned elbow grease and tons of love! While we carry classics like chocolate chip cookies & vanilla bean ice cream, we pride ourselves on creating fresh, fun and seasonal flavors that “WOW!” and get taste buds popping!

restaurant.name: Waffles de Liege
restaurant.short_description:
Waffles de Liege separates itself from most other Liege waffle eateries in that all of their dough is freshly made from scratch each morning.  You would be hard pressed to find any pre-made waffle dough in our truck.  The recipe we use is the culmination of weeks of testing and research, making sure the taste and texture is authentically Belgian. The extra work required to achieve this was never regarded as an inconvenience. Our company culture revolves around passion for the food and a dedication to providing our customers with only the best of the best. We feel that there really is no other way to serve Liege waffles than to make them fresh, prepare them fresh, and serve them fresh.

A Taste of Liege in SoCal

Originally created in the 18th century in Liege, Belgium, the Liege waffle is one of two types of “Belgian” waffles, the other type being the Brussels waffle. In the states, Brussels waffles are much more widely served and known and can be found anywhere from chain eateries to more upscale establishments. As a matter of fact, Brussels waffles are so commonplace nowadays that they are almost synonymous with the name Belgian waffles, a broad description originally reserved  both Liege and Brussels waffle types. Those who are familiar with Liege waffles know so because they have either traveled to Europe (where Liege waffles are much more popular) or are avid dessert foodies who actively seek out unique food items and/or look to recreate such items.

Read more about this great truck on Roaming Hunger's blog, here: http://roaminghunger.com/blog/4615/waffles-de-yum

restaurant.name: Haute Burger
restaurant.short_description: Haute Burger is the newest and best gourmet burger truck to hit the streets of LA. We are so committed to providing a great meal experience, that it is our number one goal. This means that everyone enjoying the Haute Burger experience is given special attention and excellent service along with equally delicious food. We grind our meat for our burgers and make our own french fries and sauces. Our flavor combinations are impeccable; like our Rich B!@tch burger that has our special 1/3 lb. tri-blend beef patty, short rib, bleu cheese foam, truffle butter, shitake, caramelized onion, and radish sprout on a toasted brioche bun. Or our Porc Chic burger that has our fresh ground 1/3 lb. pork patty, bourbon glazed pork belly, gruyere, caramelized fennel, blackberry mustard, and pickled habanero slaw on a toasted pretzel bun. We are passionate about delivering on our promise that everything we serve is made fresh to order from fresh ingredients, sourced locally, resulting in the most awesome burger experience you can imagine.

restaurant.name: The Lobos Truck
restaurant.short_description:
The Lobos Truck's motto is "Comfort food with a conscience."

Sustainable, free range and organic, local. Four words that impact our society to the core. We believe that the lighter our carbon footprint the better our world. We also believe that the love and care put into food develops more flavor and the good energy is felt by the body. 

We are taking farm to table to a whole new level with our "healthy junk food" or "comfort food with conscience". We are serving up Kobe beef burgers made with Tillimook white cheddar on locally made fresh brioche and in house made garlic aioli. We are using free range chicken wings and drums for our diablo & angel wings. Our Ribs come from happy pigs and 90% of our food is organic. It's all the flavor and half the guilt. Because at least you know you are supporting sustainable, free range, organic & local.

restaurant.name: An Nam
restaurant.short_description:
ăn: "to eat"
nam: "south", "male" or a short way of saying "vietnam"
an: "safe", "secure"

Ăn Nam: old name for Central Vietnam during French colonialism

Similar to the culture, and the food, which differs in practice and style, a slight variance in the placement of an accent mark over a word, can completely change the meaning of that word; that is the fun and beauty of the Vietnamese language.

As the prolific literatures paint the beauty of the land, the people, and the love, ăn nam truck is inspired to display these through the foods we serve.

Our menu is comprised of a fusion of elements from "western" culinary styles, those of Vietnam's neighboring countries, and traditional Vietnamese cooking.

Items such as the Filet Mignon Steaks, which is our deviation from the French "bisteak", or the baguettes, which were adapted into the Vietnamese "banh mi", are some of the most popular meals in Vietnamese dining.

Our Char-Siu (Asian BBQ) pulled pork is our take on a Chinese inspired meat dish slow cooked to achieve the texture of American pulled pork, served inside a baguette, with different types of fresh vegetables and mints.

Our spring rolls are definitely the healthiest traditional Vietnamese appetizers. Rich in nutrients and fibers, these delicious rolls are served alongside a dipping sauce, another important characteristic of Vietnamese food.

For us, ăn nam represents a linkage between the old and the new. Having been raised on traditional Vietnamese cooking in Hue, Central Vietnam, and then growing up in Southern California, the owner at ăn nam would like to preserve, and share the unique tastes of his childhood experiences along with fusion inspired techniques of modern cooking.

restaurant.name: Roll'n Lobster
restaurant.short_description: In November of 1975 I moved from a small town on the coast 30 miles south of Boston. Once I discovered the great Southern California winters there was no way I could return to the wicked cold winters of New England. The one HUGE sacrifice I was forced to make was the delicious seafood that can only be found in the ocean waters off the New England coast (GREAT LOBSTER). For many years I would have Maine Lobsters and New England clam chowder shipped to me by my family so that I could share that unique taste with all my wonderful friends and family here in Southern California. In 2008 after both of our children had graduated college, my lovely Southern California born wife and I decided to return to the coast of Massachusetts and enjoy the so called golden years, but they were still very cold winters (and a little boring) missing friends and family we decided to return and bring along with us that Great seafood we had been missing. Here enters ROLLN LOBSTER!!!!! Rolln Lobster is a Gourmet Food Truck which offers a wonderful sampling of East Coast goodies. We feature only fresh Maine Lobster (never frozen) in our Lobster Rolls, Lobster Sliders, and Lobster Louie along with great clam chowder and lobster bisque. We love to meet other transplants from the east coast and if you happen to be one of the few people who have not tried the Best the East Coast has to offer then come on by for a free sample on us. We look forward to serving you with a great New England welcome and some of the best food you’ve ever tasted.

restaurant.name: Good Greek Grub
restaurant.short_description:
Who are the faces behind Good Greek Grub? Dino Pantazis and Vasilis "Billy" Petrou. We both had an idea to bring our knowledge of cooking, the restaurant business and the love of eating Greek food to the people of Los Angeles. Our Gyros are the Souvlaki Gyros (Shish Kabob Gyros) you'd find in Greece. We refused to serve our customers mystery meat shaped into a cone . After many attempts at different recipes and many many Gyros eaten in Greece (we did it for the people) we came up with flavors that are mouth watering good. The pork souvlaki is our speciality. Not to say the rest of the food isn't as delicious but it's the one we're most proud of..... Our "claim to fame." We hope all of our FB friends have a chance to try our food and find out for themselves. 

And don't forget to try out Saganaki Bites! Created by us and sold only on the G3 truck!

Thanks for supporting us and see you around!

restaurant.name: Coolhaus
restaurant.short_description:
A Coolhaus is many things. It is an architecturally inspired ice cream sandwich. The Coolhaus consists of all-natural handmade ice creams of classic and seasonal varieties or custom-made to suit your needs, packed between two cookies of your choice. The Coolhaus is set in your hands in an edible wrapper custom-printed upon with edible ink to commemorate a place, person or event. 

A Coolhaus is also an ice cream sandwich food truck; a converted postal van with chrome rims (or Rem's), a pink top, and a fold-down bar and table. The Coolhaus truck is happily driven by architects, designers, developers, artists, bakers, actors, writers, musicians and people from other walks of life. 

A Coolhaus is also a thinker, a thinker about reclaiming public and urban space for eating and gathering, when and where it is least expected, or when it is invited to share its decadent treats with interested eaters. A Coolhaus is an innovator about how to reinvent or redesign food with epicurian sensibility but also with a search for sustainability and minimal waste. A Coolhaus is passionate about food, where it comes from, how it is made, and how it is given to the eater. A Coolhaus has a curiosity for the day-to-day gastro-experience and a devotion to the public for social merriment.

"You can’t build a house without a blueprint and you can’t build a food truck without a great idea. Natasha and Freya are the famous founders of “farchitecture” (food + architecture). All of their ice cream sandwiches are designed to resemble a deconstructed house: a cookie roof and floor slab with ice cream walls. It may sound a little farfetched, but anything goes when the food is this good." To read more about Coolhaus, check out our blog here:

http://roaminghunger.com/blog/3677/americas-coolest-haus

http://roaminghunger.com/blog/4388/food-for-thought-coolhaus

restaurant.name: MexiCalbi
restaurant.short_description:
Mexican Taco meets Korean BBQ.

These food trucks are now counting seven-vending delicious street food  meals on wheels around LA.

MexiCalbi is on the cutting edge of Korean –Mexican fusion. We take the highest quality meats, prepared using our authentic Korean marinade fuse them with fresh crisp greens, shredded cheese and wrap it all in a warm fresh Mexican tortilla to create a taste second to none. That in a nutshell is the MexiCalbi way: high quality meats, authentic ingredients – no exception.

Hot off the grill your choice of fresh marinated, perfectly seasoned Korean Beef Short Rib, Korean Style Chicken, Korean Spicy Pork or Grilled Shrimp topped with a fresh vegetable garnish and finished with our special house sauce, all served on a double warm corn tortilla. Try one of each to find your favorite! For a vegetarian option, we offer tofu.

MexiCalbi would be more than happy to roll out one of our trucks to your home, place of business or special venue to serve hot made-to-order food for you and your guests.

restaurant.name: Komodo
restaurant.short_description:
Brace yourself for a unique flavor adventure. Komodo brings you street food with a gourmet twist. Mixing 100% fresh organic ingredients and unique flavors, Komodo was created by a world class chef and designed to bring high style, high quality restaurant meals without compromising value and taste.

Chef's Bio

Erwin Tjahyadi has been an accomplished name in the LA culinary scene for over 5 years. Tjahyadi received his training from the prestigious Le Cordon Bleu in Pasadena, where he graduated with the highest honors. Specializing in mixing French Traditional cuisine with his palette for Asian Fusion, he is seasoned in orchestrating custom menus, entertainment industry galas and corporate large-scale dining events. He worked on numerous high profile projects including the Daytime Emmy's Awards, American Film Institute Awards Gala, Sony Playstation Launch Party, Pacific Design Center Annual Party, and countless others- cooking for iconic celebrities. He left his mark working at San Diego's famous Georges at the Cove and Nine Ten Restaurant. He was most recently credited as the Grill chef at the Hotel Bel Air. His latest venture is DailyYummy.com, an online recipe & social media platform where culinary professional, foodies and cooks connect, share/publish recipes and explore their interests in food. He is the vision behind Komodo; creating high style, worldly inspired, flavorful fusion dishes and bringing gourmet to the street of Los Angeles.

restaurant.name: Sweet E's Truck
restaurant.short_description:
ABOUT US:  You may know Sweet E's Bake Shop from our popular store front on 3rd Street in West Hollywood, but did you know that we also have a dessert truck?  Imagine this: your favorite Sweet E’s treats, ON WHEELS!  You can find the Sweet E's dessert truck at food truck events all around the L.A. metro area and it is also available to rent for corporate affairs, birthday parties, weddings, or any other special event!

WHAT WE SELL:  The Sweet E's truck carries a wide variety of mouth-watering sweets including cupcakes, cake pops, brownies, bars, cookies, and more!  We make a ton of flavors that will satisfy any sweet tooth.  We also may carry vegan or gluten free items for those with special diets, and our kitchen is certified Kosher.

We look forward to baking for you!

This great truck started in 2009, and quickly became a Los Angeles fixture. Why? Well, just take a look at their delicious sweets to find out: http://roaminghunger.com/blog/8078/a-sweet-tooth-for-sweet-es

restaurant.name: Woody's Grill
restaurant.short_description: Being a Southern California family, the owners of this truck wanted to bring a beach party atmosphere to the streets. So in that spirit, Woody's grill offers up a simple grilled menu that includes some of your favorite dishes such as cheese and mac, grilled shrimp, blackened ahi tuna, grilled white fish, burger sliders, crack dogs, quesadillas, burritos and more. Try a steak salad stuffed with fries! Their specialty dish is chicken crack. It is a shredded chicken recipe with southwest seasonings, black beans and corn all combined and slow cooked together. Put in in your quesadilla, a truck favorite! You can top your nachos or hot dog, or stuff it inside a burrito or tacos! Their guacamole and pico is second to none and made fresh everyday!! They travel all over Los Angeles county so you will be able to catch them soon near you!

restaurant.name: Alegría Gourmet Food Truck
restaurant.short_description:
Organic American Comfort Food with Mexican influences.

Here at Alegría Gourmet Food Truck, we consider ourselves “Professional Foodies”– we love the idea of trying new flavors, dishes, and recipes in the company of our family and friends. We believe that there is no greater pleasure than that of great food. For us, the most important of the five senses is taste.

After observing the large amounts of preservatives, antibiotics, pesticides, hormones, etc. that are added to the food we eat today, we developed the idea to offer an exquisite menu without these added chemicals.

Whether you put taste first or prefer lighter food options, our menu caters to a wide range of dining lifestyles with many items under 600 calories. Regardless of diet preferences, our guests can be confident that all of our dishes are prepared fresh with organic, locally grown ingredients free of hormones and antibiotics.

Alegría was born from the desire to find delicious dishes that are guilt-free, nutritious, and that excite the appetite.

restaurant.name: Kogi BBQ
restaurant.short_description:
Officially known as the "Kogi Beef Truck" or "Kogi Korean BBQ Truck", most people just know the Kogi BBQ Truck as "delicious."

The street food king that pulled the sword right out of the stone. You haven't had a taste of Los Angeles until you've tried a Kogi BBQ creation. 

Born from late-night hunger by founders Mark Manguera, Caroline Shin-Manguera and Chef Roy Choi, the Kogi truck is a traveling Los Angeles landmark that serves up Korean Mexican tacos, day and night.

Spicy Pork Tacos, Kimchi Quesadillas and Short Rib Sliders satiate the hungry mouths of Angelenos who crave excellent food on a dime budget.  Quality Korean barbecue meets traditional, homemade tortillas and fresh veggies to create a taste that carries the rhythms of LA street culture and exudes the warmth of all that California sun.  Under the direction of Chef Roy Choi, Kogi has developed a menu that delivers high-end food at street level prices. We look forward to seeing you on the streets!

restaurant.name: The Grilled Cheese Truck
restaurant.short_description:
Inspiration happens when you least expect it! What started as a fun, weekend activity to enter our Cheesy Mac and Rib Melt into LA's 7th Annual Grilled Cheese Invitational quickly became the idea behind . After seeing the masses of grilled cheese fanatics gathered to pay homage to our favorite childhood (and adult!) comfort food, we realized that this world needed more grilled cheese sandwiches brought to the streets. Not just the classic bread, butter and cheese, but amazing creations that are constructed with the best ingredients, local produce and made with nothing but love. 

We look forward to making your hearts melt with all of our cheesy goodness.

restaurant.name: Dogtown Dogs
restaurant.short_description:
Dogtown Dogs is the most compelling gourmet truck concept to emerge. The economic downturn is forcing diners to find quality alternatives to restaurant dining. Not willing to skimp on flavor and a sense of experience, our Foodies will have an opportunity to enjoy the best of everything at a fraction of the price.

Each dog on the menu presents a sophisticated variation of traditional favorites with an innovative spin. Artful in presentation, the soulful flavors elicit a sense of nostalgia as you bite into the best dog of your life. A side of crispy tater tots becomes the ultimate accoutrement. Soy dogs are an available option for veggie lovers!

MUST TRY: 
Spicy Algeleno - Bacon wrapped all beef dog topped with salsa fresca, tomatillo sauce and fried jalapenos. 

To read about the experience of serving on this truck, and why food truck operators are just about the hardest workers there are, check out the blog post on Roaming Hunger here: http://roaminghunger.com/blog/4471/its-a-dog-eat-dog-world

restaurant.name: Green Truck
restaurant.short_description: Mission: Healing our planet, one meal at a time. Green Truck serves an all organic menu sourced from local organic farms, and their trucks run on waste veggie oil. Yep, that’s right, the all-natural vegetable oil they use to cook is recycled and fuels the Green Truck. Even their packaging and utensils are made from compostable materials. Try their signature Mother Trucker vegan veggie burger, add an heirloom beet salad and an organic fresh-squeezed lemonade and you’ve got their “Happy Trucker Meal”. But for all you pescatarians and carnivores, don’t worry they’ve got you covered. The free-range chicken pesto wrap or wahoo fish tacos will sustainably satisfy your taste buds.

There are about 800 Million curry sausages served per year in Germany. The trend in Germany is to offer curry sausage as a more premium fast food experience in a wider variety, e.g. pork, veal, beef sausage as well as different sauces.

restaurant.name: The Urban Oven
restaurant.short_description:
The Urban Oven is a mobile wood fired artisan pizza truck. Authentic delicious Napoletana pizzas made from our one of a kind wood fired oven food truck. Serving on the streets of L.A. and available for private events.

LIVING A FEW BLOCKS AWAY from one of the greatest pizzerias in the world can have a lasting effect on some people. Such is the case for Scott Tremonti who spent decades near the world renowned Pizzeria Bianco in Phoenix, AZ. That experience lit a fire in his belly that just couldn't be put out (pun intended). He began his lifelong quest to create his own authentic Neapolitan style wood fired artisan pizza, and after years of experience and training by some of today's best pizzaiolos, Scott is ready to share his authentic artisan pizzas with the people of Los Angeles. Through his custom built mobile food truck with an actual wood fired oven, he makes each pizza fresh as it's ordered.

restaurant.name: Patty Wagon
restaurant.short_description:
A Los Angeles food truck serving grass fed, responsibly made burgers to hungry Angelenos.

We are passionate about providing healthy, sustainable, delicious and flavorful beef.  All of our animals are exclusively pasture raised in Teton Valley, Idaho.  Unlike animals raised in factory farms, our cattle are never fed grain or anything else unnatural to their diet.  They are never given any steroids, growth hormones or antibiotics.  Our cattle live naturally, on green pastures, which means we are able to provide beef that tastes the way nature intended!

LA Street food sourced right!

restaurant.name: WISE BARBECUE TRUCK - TEXAS BBQ
restaurant.short_description:
AUTHENTIC TEXAS-STYLE SMOKEHOUSE MEATS: 

BEEF BRISKET - USDA PRIME Black Angus Beef Brisket. Pepper crusted and wood fire smoked for over 15 hours. Tender and delicious with authentic Texas cowboy barbecue flavor.

TRI-TIP -  USDA PRIME Black Angus Tri-Tip Smoked with only Red Oak. Sliced and Served with our Signature Flavor Barbecue Sauce.

PULLED PORK - Yorkshire Pork Shoulder. Signature dry rub and slow smoked overnight. Just the right amount of sweet and spice cooked until the bark is crispy and the meat falls off the bone. Pulled and served with a touch of honey.

BARBECUE CHICKEN - Tender and delicious thighs and legs smoked to perfection. We pull the meat from the bone and serve on a sandwich or a plate.

HOT LINK - Hand Made Beef Sausage. With a jalapeno kick and a smokey finish our  Hot Links are the real deal.

SPARE RIBS - Full Racks of Pork Ribs. Coated with dry rub and smoked slow and low for up to 5 hours. Our ribs are flavorful and tender and the meat pulls from the bone just the way you want it to.

restaurant.name: Let's Be Frank
restaurant.short_description:
Let's be Frank was founded by Sue Moore and Larry Bain, fast-food visionaries who started the company in 2005 with the simple goal of changing the world one hot dog at a time. Sue, formerly the "meat forager" for Berkeley, CA's famed Chez Panisse, and Larry, longtime restaurant professional, member of the San Francisco Sustainable Food Systems team, and advocate of the benefits of local, healthy foods, joined forces to return the much-demeaned hot dog to its rightful position: an icon for a healthy food system. Their goal was that their frank would become a way to nourish both eaters and growers. Let's be Frank supports the ever-shrinking group of family farmers and ranchers committed to raising their animals in a humane, conscientious, and healthy manner and in so creates dogs gone good.
It took over 18 months of tinkering with our third-generation sausage makers to perfect the recipe for our dogs. Once we did, our fist cart (opened in June 2005 outside San Francisco's Giants ballpark), quickly commanded crowds, lured by the smell of onions sizzling on the grill. We soon added a second cart outside the Warming Hut at Crissy Field near the Golden Gate Bridge.

Knowing that no town is as passionate about its dogs as Los Angeles, Sue and Larry expanded to Culver City in the fall of 2007. Our big red truck, frequently seen hot-dogging around the streets of Silverlake and Culver City, was inaugurated in the spring of 2008.

The success of the business in both San Francisco and Los Angeles, as well as an ever-increasing array of fans (and product ideas!) led us to open a small shop in San Francisco in May of 2009. The shop serves up both prepared dogs with a variety of homemade toppings and sides, packaged goods including "Party Packs" (everything you need to throw a complete Frank Fest at home or on the go), and .

Throughout the years since Frank's birth, we've continued to work on new products which support our mission of creating delicious food that delights our fans and support the work of local, family-owned farms and ranches. From our family-farmed pork bratwurst and spicy "hot" dog to our signature Devil Sauce (a diabolically delicious spicy topping), our products reflect our commitment to ensuring that Let's be Frank is really the home of dogs gone good.

restaurant.name: Takoyaki Tanota
restaurant.short_description:
Takoyaki!? What!?

What the heck is “Takoyaki”???
Osaka!! Without any exaggeration you could probably say, Takoyaki = Osaka and vice versa.  Takoyaki was originated from the streets of Osaka way back in it’s days.  The round shaped shells are made from eggs and flour and on the inside there are octopus pieces and a mix of veggies.  We use a special grill to cook “Takoyaki”, specially made for it.

In the old school days in Osaka they use to say if you are a newly wedded wife to a family, better bring your Takoyaki grill.  People in Japan, especially in Osaka love Takoyaki.

Mission Statement of Tanota

Our goal is to introduce this fabulous tradition food of Osaka called the “Takoyaki” to the people outside of Japan.  We want everyone from all over the world to actually eat and experience how awesome this “Takoyaki” thing is and spread the word to the world.  It ain’t easy introducing something new to the world but look at “Sushi” now!  People thought it was the most disgusting food in the world when it was first starting to spread, 
Shouldn’t be harder than Sushi because it’s cooked!

Anyways…..
At Tanota our Takoyaki shell is based from a traditional egg and flour base but with a little bit of original touch to it.  We add a secret chicken base soup to the base which makes our Takoyaki even better.  At the end when the Takoyaki is cooked the shell will have a puffy kind of feel but on the inside it’ll have a melty soft kind of feel to it.  Be careful because the melty soft inside can be very hot!

The ingredients of our Takoyaki are………
Octopus, Green Onions, Ginger, Tempura pieces.

They are topped with…….
Our special Tanota Original sauce, Mayo, Dried Seaweed, and some more Green Onions.

We hope you enjoy and spread the love!!

restaurant.name: Meat the Greek
restaurant.short_description:
Meat The Greek is a family owned business with one of a kind recipes since the late 1930â€™s. These recipes of gourmet cuisine are fresh cooked meals that we bring to you on wheels.It all began in the beautiful country of Greece, where the Mavropoulos family started a company of extra olive oil and cheese.

Unfortunately due to the financial crisis that has struck the country, the decision was made for the whole family, which lead to the move to California, which created the idea of bringing the essence of Greece to this side of the world by introducing foods from the different islands of Greece, along with their passion for serving people.

The family continues their traditional foods that are cooked with natural ingredients, and itgave form to starting a business to show people a part of the culture. Everything down to the special sauce ingredients is imported from Greece.

The recipes that have been passed down from generations from Grandmothers to daughters to sons, have been built up for over 70 years.

"Greek specialties are created for the people, as if they are coming into our home" stated Chef and son, Dimitri, "The Mavropoulos family feels privileged of fulfilling a taste of happiness to the people, and we will continue to share our heritage with authentic meals along the road."

"We sincerely thank you for your support of our food, our mission and our recipes"

Harry & Eleni
Dimitri & Ruth

restaurant.short_description:
Come and enjoy our unique Food that originated in the heart and soul of New Orleans. The Crazy Creole Café catering truck, we are the café that rolls to you. We offer Authentic Creole and Cajun dishes. Most of our products are shipped in weekly from New Orleans, like our famous French bread, or the mayonaise we use on our po boys. We also serve Alligator, farm raised catfish, crawfish and more, all shipped in. 

We use only the best ingredients. Louisiana cuisine is at the heart of our unique culture. Created by the fusion of African, Native American and the European Ancestry. You are guaranteed to enjoy great flavors of my home town of Nawlins and we will show you what southern hospitality is all about. 

In New Orleans we have a saying "bon temp rollers" which means lets the good time roll. That is what our truck is all about. Good food & good music. 

We will do our best to put a big smile on your face and make you stomp your feet. So what are you waiting for? Come on and Bon temp rollers!

restaurant.name: Shave Ice Truck

The Los Angeles Shave Ice Truck is here to serve delicious and refreshing Hawaiian style shave ice treats all over the Los Angeles area. 

Our Shave Ice is made with fluffy snow, not crunchy snow cone ice. All our syrups are made with real cane sugar and never with high fructose corn syrup.  This is a real melt in your mouth, good to the last spoonful dessert.

Shave Ice is a no guilt treat! 
Vegan, Gluten Free, Low Calorie, Lactose Free, Fat Free

Ice Cream, Sweet Cream, Azuki Beans, and Li Hing Mui can be added for an additional cost. We also have a select amount of Agave based syrups per request.  

Lastly, we are committed to helping the environment. We will only use compostable bowls and spoons.

restaurant.name: Lobsta Truck
restaurant.short_description:
The Lobsta Truck is the premier LA provider of the ocean's most prized crustacean. Get a taste and find them to have a lobster dinner or lunch.

A few weeks after a wonderful trip to the east coast, we decided that we were going to open the Lobsta Truck. With the lobster shacks in Maine similar to the taco shacks in LA, it seemed like the perfect fit. We proceeded to find a supplier that could deliver us fresh lobster and worked on developing our own lobster rolls. We tried a few types of bread, as we couldn't find the traditional split top New England rolls in LA, but it just wasn't right. As a result, like the lobster, we get our bread fresh from New England. We couldn't just have lobster rolls as our only menu item, so we decided to also add crab rolls, New England clam chowder, Cape Cod chips, and fresh squeezed lemonade. With all the pieces in place, we were ready to roll!

restaurant.name: South Philly Experience
restaurant.short_description:
The Philly to LA exodus is well-documented: you're born and raised, spend most of your days chilling out max on a playground, and, when a couple of guys start making trouble in your neighborhood, you move out West, get deep into Scientology and marry that Matrix chick that did Laurence Fishburne. Though others might just start a cheesesteak food truck, like South Philly Experience.

Just getting rolling, SPE is a new sandwich food truck dedicated to replicating the street food flavors of the region that bears its name, run by recently-transplanted cousins who worked together in an Italian restaurant back home, yet somehow managed to actually move out of their mothers' houses anyways. Illadelphness starts with sandwiches like traditional cheesesteak with or w/o onions plus provolone, American, or wiz; chicken cutlet w/ spinach, broccoli rabe, or roasted peppers; roasted pork w/ cheese or greens; and meatball and chicken parm subs; all are served on classic rolls imported from the Philly bakery Amoroso, a process that everyone agrees was a total bitch. Sides include fresh cut fries, meatballs, peppers, spinach, and rabe, as well as three varieties of the hard-to-find TastyKakes: the chocolate-covered Peanut Butter Kandy Kake, moist Butterscotch Krimpets, and straight-up chocolate cupcakes, which spend their downtime depressed that they're not loved enough to misspell.

restaurant.name: Tokyo Doggie Style
restaurant.short_description:
Tokyo Doggie Style Food Truck has been in operation since the spring of 2013, serving CIA alumnus Chef Keith Yokoyama’s uniquely tasty creations of Japanese fusion comfort food on the streets, at offices, and for events throughout Southern California. The truck offers a variety of dishes and craft specialty drinks that are chef-inspired, innovative yet casual and fun. The menu includes original Japanese fusion hot dogs, signature hoagies, and vegan/gluten-free choices. In June 2014, Tokyo Doggie Style was named in the exclusive CBS Los Angeles’ ranking series, “Best of LA”, as one of “The Best Food Trucks in Los Angeles”. CBS LA recognized TDS for its “delicious and interesting” menu and friendly service.
In November 2014, Tokyo Doggie Style will be featured in travel cookbook, "Food Truck Road Trip—A Cookbook" (by Kim Pham,
Philip Shen and Terri Phillips) . The book will introduce recipes for two TDS signature hot dogs -- “100% Homie Veggie Dog” (made-from-scratch vegetarian) and the “Bacon Wrapped Hawaiian Terrier-ki dog” (a best-seller!).
Tokyo Doggie Style takes pride in quality food and sincere, Japanese-style hospitality. Our mission is to bring our favorite flavors and friendly service directly to you!

restaurant.name: Mangia Ristorante On Wheels

Our Gourmet  Food Truck is:
Mangia Italian Ristorante on Wheels
Mangia = Eat Italian
 
Appropriately our slogan on our Truck is:
Mangia E Statti Zitto - Italian  "Shut up and Eat!" - English

Specialties:

From our Parmigiano and Provolone cheeses to our Plump Chicken, Italian Sausage, Tri Tip, and Pastrami.  An earthy aroma of zesty garlic fills the truck while grilling your selection. High energy carries through in the unique bold flavors of each of our Entrees.

A couple of our Italian favorites are Chicken Pesto with Smoken Chile Verde Sauce Quesadilla,

restaurant.name: The Fluff Ice Truck
restaurant.short_description:
Recently named Zagat’s LA Food Truck of the Week, our adorable Fluff Ice Truck is now roaming the streets of LA peddling our unique twist on the traditional shave ice dessert.
 
As the name suggests, Fluff Ice is fluffy. We take the traditional shave ice process and turn it upside down. By pre-flavoring our ice blocks before we shave them, we are able to create whole ribbon-like sheets of Fluff Ice that is not only light in texture but amazing in taste.
 
We are constantly rotating our menu on the truck with the menu at our store in Monterey Park, CA. Look for us at your local food truck event, farmer’s market, or community event!

To learn about the creation of the truck, why it's always good to have friends in the food truck community, and what Fluff Ice means when they say "edible plastic," read Roaming Hunger's blog here: http://roaminghunger.com/blog/4581/what-the-fluff

restaurant.name: Romolos Cuisine
restaurant.short_description:
The “Romolo’s Italian Cuisine” is an Italian inspired food-truck, operating in Los Angeles area that serves mostly Italian dishes and some domestic food.

Chef Romolo Palermo left his homeland of Calabria, Italy in 1985 at the age of 21, and moved to Germany. The young Romolo worked in many restaurants in the Bavarian area, and for several years, including at “Il Grappolo, & La Vecchia Masseria” two of the most famous “Italian Restaurants” in Munich. He may be from the south of Italy, but his style of cooking involves the cuisine of different regions of Italy.

He came to California in 2004 and his vision is to keep the cuisine simple and fresh, using Italian and local ingredients. He truly believes everything tastes better if you cook with enthusiasm, passion, and love. In addition, he thinks sharing good recipes at our tables, is crucial to leading a fulfilling life.

After working on many culinary events with Chef Sebastiano Sposito over the past five years, now he is ready to his newest venture, Romolo’s Italian Cuisine in January 2012, where he will serve best Italian and domestic signature dishes at fairly low prices.

restaurant.name: Yalla Truck
restaurant.short_description:
We are here to bring you a wonderfully new, and diverse twist to traditional MIddle Eastern / Mediterranean food.  We specialize in Falafel but also have an other non-vegetarian Mediterranean, street food staples.
 >In case you wondering: Falafels balls are a wonderful mesh of grounded garbanzo beans, various veggies, and spices. Fried to create a delicious crunchy outer shell. The balls are in then placed in a made fresh daily bread pocket with your combination choice of vegetables, pickled veggies, and dressings.

All falafel sandwiches are 100% vegatarian, and 100% delicious!

Our standard truck menu is posted here on Roaming hunger but other options are available upon request.  We can cater to all vegetarian crowds and we can also mix it up, catering to the non-vegetarians as well.

restaurant.name: Crepe'n Around
restaurant.short_description:
Creating gourmet crepes for Crepe Lovers in Los Angeles from our food truck. Watch out for us as we start Crepe'n Around serving crepey street food.

Who knew…when sisters Eileen and Joann DeLeoz were eating their crepes right under the Eiffel Tower back in 2006, that it was the beginning of their Crepe’n Around adventure.

But if you ask their parents, Alan and Josefa, they’d probably say growing up Filipino-American—the huge family gatherings and the endless days and nights cooking in the kitchen—that drove Eileen and Joann to Crepe’n Around.

Fast forward to 2010, Crepe’n Around offers foodies anything from the sweet crepes we all love—Strawberries and Cream, Banana Nutella, and S’more, to savory crepes filled with Teriyaki Flank Steak, Ham & Brie, Maple Braised Pork and Chicken Pesto.

No matter what your palette, Crepe’n Around brings high-quality crepes at street level prices for everyone to enjoy.

ABOUT EILEEN DeLEOZ
Earning her Diplôme de Pâtisserie from Le Cordon Bleu Paris, Eileen brings her experience and the traditions from the world-renowned kitchens of France to the streets of Los Angeles.

Before living, breathing and cooking all things French, Eileen earned her AOS in Culinary Arts from the California Culinary Academy in San Francisco, California.

While formal culinary training and education has certainly built a solid foundation for her culinary career, there’s nothing that compares to her hands-on, in-your-face, kitchen hell (pun intended!) experience working at the Michelin, starring Gordon Ramsay in West Hollywood, California, and Patina at the Walt Disney Concert Hall in Downtown Los Angeles.

ABOUT JOANN DeLEOZ
With a background in broadcast communications and marketing, Joann tends to the administration, media relations and special event responsibilities of Crepe’n Around.

restaurant.name: Sweet Lucie's
restaurant.short_description:
Sweet Lucie’s provides premium organic ice cream and organic toppings to Southern California private parties and events in a classic 1959 ice cream truck or a vintage Italian ice cream cart.

We only use organic, all natural ingredients and select fair trade chocolates,
teas, and coffees. The ice cream and sauces are handmade specifically for your special event. Our serving cups and spoons are not only recyclable but compostable as well.

Sweet Lucie’s evokes an era when ice cream was made with simple, natural ingredients. Using only simple, all natural organic ingredients is better for both you and the planet.

Sweet Lucie’s all started when owner, Geri Czako, had a craving for something sweet.

Geri was expecting her first child and wanted ice cream. To satiate her ice cream craving, but also to ensure that the ingredients were delicious, superior, and organic, Geri decided to make her own.

After months of experimentation, along with attending the world-famous Penn State Ice Cream course, Geri developed the ideal combination of organic ingredients and sweet perfection. Oh, and, Geri had her baby girl.

restaurant.name: Smokin' Willies
restaurant.short_description:
I am Smokin' Willie. The new Smokin' Willie's Gourmet BBQ Truck has just come out to bring you "BBQ Sauce so good it's unethical"

It all began with Mom in 1967. We lived in Lake View Terrace, California, a suburb of Los Angeles. It was early on a Saturday morning (we do not remember the exact date) that an old pick-up truck with a homemade fifty-five gallon barrel BBQ on a trailer pulled up across the street for a family reunion. They started the BBQ on the driveway, and a couple of hours later the smell of this amazing BBQ was blowing in the direction of our house and driving us all crazy. My Mom invited herself to the family reunion and came back raving about the BBQ and the sauce that they used. Mom tried to get the recipe for the BBQ Sauce but was not able to finagle the recipe out of them.

Finally, after what seemed like years of intense begging and maybe some threats, desperate people do crazy things, Mom got a list of some of the ingredients on a paper napkin. She practically ran home to make the first batch of sauce and was very disappointed. The sauce turned out bland and was definitely not the sauce she had tasted before. Mom was on a quest to make this sauce work so she started doing research on BBQ Sauce recipes from different parts of the country-- adding this, taking away that, more of this and less of that.

Mom made many batches of BBQ sauce, each improving over the previous batch. In 1969 when we landed a man on the moon, we had a neighborhood BBQ and Mom’s sauce was a hit. Smokin’ Willie’s BBQ Sauce was established.

Mom started canning the sauce in mason jars and the demand grew. In the early 1990’s she was making sauce and selling it to help sponsor my brother Brian’s race car. Mom has been a stock car race fan for as long as I can remember, and she is Brian’s #1 fan to this day.

I worked for Warner Bros. Records and had the best job in the world! As the music industry became more corporate, money became more important than the quality of the music and I started looking into other endeavors for the future. The demand for Mom’s sauce was increasing and I began to help her make larger batches. One day Mom said that she wished she could share “the best BBQ sauce” with more people. So in 1999 I started Wild Bill’s Foods to try and market Mom’s Sauce. After a few tries, none very successful, I shelved the BBQ Sauce idea to make a living in the banking industry, but I was missing the sauce and Mom was missing me!

Bored by the financial world but having socked away some cash, on February 22, 2005, Smokin’ Willie’s was reborn. Chef Michael Acuna was brought on board and with his amazing talent turned Mom’s recipe into a manufacturing formula. When we brought Mom to the manufacturing plant for the first run, she tasted the sauce and with a tear in her eye she said “You did it, now I don’t have to cook the sauce for six hours anymore.” And with Mom’s blessing, we were off and running

Bill “Smokin Willie” Kelley is the go-to guy if you want to know about grillin’. He’s been tending the coals for over 3 decades and teaches classes, privately and in groups. He also does cooking demos at Whole Foods Markets, Home Shows, and Fancy Food Shows—almost anyplace where people are enthusiastic about delicious food. A lifelong grillin’ enthusiast, Bill made his passion his profession when he started Wild Bill’s Foods in 2005. He has built a successful company on the foundation of his mom’s spectacular barbecue sauce and his own love of grillin’. His thoughts, secrets, tips and recipes are in his new signature book, Smokin’ Willie’s Guide to Great Grillin’. Bill lives in the Los Angeles area with Diana, his wife of 28 years, and their two sons, Matt & Nick, who wouldn’t miss a family barbecue for anything.

restaurant.name: The Slummin' Gourmet
restaurant.short_description:
The Slummin' Gourmet is modern bistro fare recreated for the streets... 
... Fancy Without the Schmancy

sometimes, you’re just hungry for good food.  like, interesting snooty-tooty, fancy-pants food, but you’re so down to earth you’re above snooty-tooty, and at the moment you just don’t want to put on your fancy pants (they’re being pressed).

so where’s the in-between?  upscale doesn’t have to mean uppity, says chef tony, so what does he do?  he proves it, in his black coat and black truck, with the slummin’ gourmet.

from his ever-popular walnut shrimp tacos (just ask ken) to his kobe beef sliders (don’t you dare call it a burger buddy – but high five if you remember those, man), tony, sous chef gabe and crew crank out some of the tastiest, classiest culinary fare ever to come off a food truck.

just don’t ask for silverware (you’ll get plastic).  while the die-hards eschew utencils, newbies take heed:  it’s okay to eat with your hands — we’ve got napkins.

restaurant.name: Gourmet Genie
restaurant.short_description:
The Gourmet Genie is often shocked by how man Mortals in Los Angeles are unfamiliar with the term "Cal-Med" or California-Mediterranean! 

The Mediterranean Region, where the Gourmet Genie (GG for short) hails from, is rich in exotic spices and both the people and genies incorporate them in their simple recipes: grilled meats, fresh salads and delicious side dishes with just a few ingredients.   The "California" part comes in because the Genie is a master of putting a modern and healthy (just like L.A.!) spin on this classic cuisine.

We are certain you will love the food no matter where you come from.   And now you know why we call our cuisine "Cal-Med".  You heard it here first.  Don't be surprised when it catches on!

Thailand is labeled "paradise" not only for its breathtaking beauty and inspiring culture, but also for its culinary brilliance. From adrenaline-rush Bangkok to serene seaside towns in the South and tranquil villages located along the Mekong River, Thai cuisine is as rich and diverse as its culture. With palabok as its specialty, Neri’s Restaurant was started in 1985 by Neri and Romy, both accountants by profession. For the past 26 years, Neri’s Restaurant has become well-known for its puto, kutsinta and other native snacks and delicacies. restaurant.name: Angie's Wieners
restaurant.short_description:
Angie’s Wieners is the incarnation of founder Angie Stevenson’s effort to provide super sized gourmet hot dogs in a fun entertaining fashion to the people of Southern California via her specially built food truck. Each wiener is crafted under her own label for Angie per her recipes from free range beef, chicken, and pork, including a vegetarian option for those who prefer. Placed on a hot steamy bun, topped with an inventive array of the finest ingredients, each bite brings out of this world flavor!

On top it all off each order is served with a giggle and a smile by Angie and/or one of her gorgeous wiener babes.

This amazing combination of steamy goodness led to the Angie’s Wiener’s tag line:”The Biggest Wieners and the Hottest Buns!”

With all the key components in place, Angie’s Wieners is taking on a life of its own. restaurant.name: The Mighty Boba Truck
restaurant.short_description:
Partners Frances Lee and Luca Tseng together have over 5 years experience working at and managing Asian tea houses. There they learned and reinvented the art of making tea-based beverages and cooking Taiwanese cuisine. Additionally, Frances has been exposed to the tea industry for over 15 years through her family. Both owners have a vast knowledge of Taiwanese street foods and the boba tea industry because of their own cultures and growing up tasting these items.

The Mighty Boba Truck offers main dishes, known as Mighty Heroes, featuring Buttermilk Popcorn Chicken, Island Pork Chop, Taiwanese Sweet Sausage, and Marinated Tofu Steak. In addition, we serve sides (namely Sidekicks) such as Sweet Butter Toast, Consensed Milk Toast, and Honey Sweet Potato Fries. We also invent Specials of the Month items to add to the variety of flavors.

Most importantly, The Mighty Boba Truck delivers TASTE-omizable Mighty Concoctions, made-to-order tapioca Boba Tea beverages. Choose from Black Tea, Green Tea, several Milk Teas (Regular, Honey, Almond) and many Refreshing Teas (Passion Fruit, Honey, Mango), with or without sweet gummy boba balls. Yum…Special requests (less sugar/milk, etc) are welcome; if we can do it, we’ll do it. And just like our food selection, we introduce new Flavor of the Month to stimulate different taste buds. ^_^v

restaurant.name: Sugar Babies
restaurant.short_description:
Sugar Babies Cupcakery are some of the most sought after cupcakes in Los Angeles.  The Cupcake truck stops Monday-Saturday, delivering our signature moist and flavorful minis throughout the Southern California area. Delivery/Catering also available for your next wedding, shower, or event!

Sugar Babies Cupcakery began to take form when co-owner Kassandra Workman discovered a hidden passion for confections and baking in 2006. A hit with friends and family, Kassandra was soon catering her famous macaroons to a local art gallery, making fondant-covered cakes for birthday parties, and crafting cookie bouquets for baby showers and other events. 

After moving to Los Angeles with sister and Sugar Babies Cupcakery co-owner, Rachel Crystal, the sisters quickly tired of the oversized, cookie-cutter desserts at local bakeries. Recognizing the need for a more reasonably-portioned, fun and flavorful treat, the signature mini cupcakes of Sugar Babies Cupcakery were born.

These days, they wake early each morning to craft their signature baby cupcakes, load them onto the cupcakery truck, and drive their creations all over the city for your enjoyment. Their hearts and hard work helped make their dream a reality, and with each Sugar Babies cupcake you purchase, you all help to keep it alive! So thank you, Sugar Babies customers, for your business and your continuing support of all things sweet.

tweet.text: Incredible photos of the universe...made from food! http://t.co/nDhrMH5ffx

restaurant.name: Sprinkles Mobile
restaurant.short_description:
The very famous Sprinkles cupcakes now offered on the go!

Street food never tasted so sweet as eating Red Velvet cupcakes curbside. Where's the milk-mobile?

My great grandmother was renowned for the distinctive desserts she made at her San Francisco restaurant during the 1930's. She created pure, delicious, uncomplicated pastries – the result of her French culinary roots and her new American working life. These days, as I sift, whisk and frost at the bakery I began with my husband in Beverly Hills, I imagine our scratch-based cupcakes as a natural extension of my great grandmother's legacy.

As we continue the tradition of simple and satisfying desserts handcrafted from the best ingredients – not too precious, always just right – our hope is that Sprinkles Cupcakes will conjure up lovely memories of your own childhood or family, or simply the pleasure of good taste.

restaurant.name: Rosa's Bella Cucina
restaurant.short_description:
Rosa's Bella Cucina is a taste of New Jersey Italian Deli right in the streets of Los Angeles.

Rosa’s Bella Cucina is generation 2.0 of the famed DePalma Brothers Italian Delicatessen and well known Italian food caterers of New Jersey.

For over 30 years DePalma Brothers, which is owned and operated by The Graziano family who are natives of Naples, Italy, has acted as the hub to the Italian community in the Northern New Jersey area. The location is not only known for their divine specialty imported foods but for its atmosphere of Old World Italy. Rosa Graziano (the 1st American generation daughter of Angela & Giovanni Graziano) is being passed the torch with her families blessings as she brings this same Old World Italian tradition to the community of Los Angeles through Rosa’s Bella Cucina, an Italian Kitchen/Delicatessen on Wheels, which acts as a great new satellite Italian kitchen for all your catering needs.

For the last 8 years, Rosa’s Zeppole booth has been one of the most popular booths at the Feast of San Gennaro Hollywood, getting high praises from fellow American Italians like Jimmy Kimmel and Ray Romano and has been featured on many news and TV programs such as VH1‘s Morning Show and KTLA.

Through Rosa’s active involvement with Los Angeles Italian societies; The Sons of Italy Hollywood Lodge, UNICO and the National Italian American Foundation, Rosa has been a mainstay and local fan favorite amongst all feast and event goers. After much persuasion from the west coast Italian community, Rosa has finally decided to bring a piece of her Italian culture and her passed down old world Italian recipes to Los Angeles by opening up Rosa’s Bella Cucina. Taking the lead from her family business but turning it up a notch Rosa has created an Italian kitchen on wheels. Rosa’s Bella Cucina brings Old School Italian traditions and the foods you all know and love. A lil’ sample of whats to come: Arancini, Italian sandwiches filled with the best Italian ingredients and other hot and cold specialty items.

restaurant.name: Grill 'Em All
restaurant.short_description:
Two dudes, a truck and a megaphone: the story of Grill 'Em All

Heavy Metal and cult culture fill your head with so many visions and ideas. They make your soul glow with the unholy light and create sensations to the senses. But still they leave your stomach empty and sad. Take heed heshers: Grill 'Em All is here to fill the void that music and mayhem can not. Enter the realm of the burger.

Grill 'Em All is steadfast in the belief that the heavy metal and culinary worlds were bound to collide one day in a victorious marriage of massive meat and riffage. Where better for this battle to commence than in the city of fallen angels? Los Angeles, your cries in the night have been answered. Cry no more!

Grill 'Em All is led into the burger battle by the team of Chef Ryan Harkins and Matthew Chernus. The two have been allies and band mates for over twenty years. Ryan has paid his dues as a veteran of professional kitchens for over a decade strong, having worked in Chicago, Los Angeles, St. Louis, Columbus and Cleveland, Ohio. The combination of his fine dining background and strong Midwestern roots has left him with the desire to place a gourmet take on his first love, the hamburger. Dare to stop him! Matthew, also beckoned as the Future of America, is an ex-professional wrestler and he owns a megaphone. Need I say more on his behalf? I dare not in fear of being Liger Bombed through a barbed wire board with black widows and broken forties of King Cobra beneath.

Together they are ready to turn the key, they are ready to hit the streets, and they are ready to... GRILL 'EM ALL!

restaurant.name: Haole Boys Shave Ice LA
restaurant.short_description:
Authentic Hawaiian Style Shave Ice

Haole Boys Shave Ice is committed to bringing the the best shave ice to Southern California. We pride ourselves in providing authentic Hawaiian style Shave Ice with highest quality ingredients and flavor. Our syrups are hand-made and our block of ice are carefully freeze daily.

Community Events

Haole Boys Shave Ice specializes in various community events; music, art, film and cultural festivals, carnivals, concerts, family events, sporting events, movie premiers and community celebrations. Our gourmet dessert truck is specifically designed to handle high attendance events.

Private Catering

Haole Boys Shave Ice has taken the classic Shave Ice stand off the Hawaiian beach and brings it to your front door, or business establishment, with a few modern twists. Whether you are looking for the great classic Hawaiian taste or wanting to mix it up with something a little more adventurous we have the Shave Ice for you.

What Makes Us Different?

Authentic Hawaiian Shave Ice starts with top quality ingredients. We hand-make all of our syrups with pure Hawaiian cane sugar, NEVER high fructose corn syrup. Our blocks of ice are made daily with pure filtered water and frozen at a precise temperature to achieve a perfect shave. The ice blocks are hand shaved whenever possible to exactly the right consistency to create the best "shave ice". The fluffy snow must be packed down perfectly: too little and the soft ice will melt when the syrup is added turning to a slushy; too much and the flavor will not soak into the ice and sink to the bottom making a snow cone. We pride ourselves on having the best melt, a skill even seasoned shavers have difficulty perfecting!

The Melt

The Melt is the way the freshly shaven ice melts into your tongue. Shave ice is not crunchy like a snow cone with syrup at the bottom - every bite of delicious Hawaiian Style Shave Ice melts in your mouth and bursts with flavor. Our syrups are infused into the ice creating flavors designed to evaporate on your tongue and explode with flavor. It's all about the melt and Haole Boys Shave Ice has the best!

restaurant.name: Fresh Street Food Truck
restaurant.short_description:
After working in the corporate world for years Jon Young owner/ operator of Fresh Street Food Truck decided to move from eating catered food to making and serving it.  Fresh Street Food Truck serves freshly made vegetarian, vegan, carnivore and gluten free cuisine from all over the world.  They take "fresh" to a new level right down to making their own mustard, dressings and sauces.
Their commitment to fresh goes right down to inspecting the sub-ingredients of the few products they do buy.  The motto is simple... If you can't pronounce it they don't serve it.

To read more about Young's philosophies and the great dishes you might find on this truck, check out the Roaming Hunger blog here: http://roaminghunger.com/blog/7425/the-revolution-is-fresh

restaurant.name: Trailer Park Truck
restaurant.short_description:
Trailer Park Truck is about great food and good times. 

It is the vision of Dave Miller, who spent his youth touring the world in a punk rock band, then working in the NYC music industry and party scene before finally settling in Santa Monica where he saw the need for a new kind of food truck experience.  

Miller teamed up with some of the most talented chefs in LA to develop a menu of amazing “gourmet American comfort food with a twist”.  But he soon realized that it’s about more than just amazing food (you can get that on any street corner in Los Angeles) -- Trailer Park Truck is a 24-hour traveling food party! Whether you're watching Beavis and Butthead or Dukes of Hazard while waiting to place your order or munching on the some of the best street food in LA while sitting on lawn chairs next to pink flamingos listening to 80’s hair bands, you’ll always leave Trailer Park Truck  saying, “Damn, that was fun! And dang tasty too!” And that's why we do it—for the love of great food and good fun! 

Welcome to the party…Trailer Park Truck has arrived.

restaurant.name: It's In The Sauce BBQ

restaurant.name: MOE Deli
restaurant.short_description:
Montreal Open-Ended Eggrolls & Delicatessen on Wheels

We bring the rare jewnese delicacy of Montreal open-ended eggrolls to the streets of southern California. Besides our signature eggrolls, we also roll with some classic deli favorites such as sandwiches, sides and salads. You will want some MOE!

Here's the scoop. For centuries, the Jews and the Chinese have loved each other's food. At the end of the 20th century, daring food explorers began to marry these two cuisines and create a provocative and modern fair called Jewnese. M.O.Eggrolls is the first gourmet food truck to bring this new flavor to Los Angeles.

Crispy wrappers, toasted ends and overflowing filling makes a Montreal eggroll better than any other. Our eggrolls are rolled tightly around copious amounts of exotic fillings, leaving the ends open to become brown and toasty. The end bites are the most coveted bites of a Montreal eggroll!

Combine equal parts seasonal, local and kosher ingredients, wrap in a fine eggroll skin and lightly fry to crispy crunchy deliciousness and you have a M.O.Eggroll. The menu is rooted in the traditions that Mom and Bubby taught, but is inspired by modern techniques, and the pursuit of super tasty grub. Bright and crisp accompaniments and house made dipping sauces cleanse the pallet between rich and succulent mouthfuls of eggroll. Wash it all down with an ice cold cup of organic iced tea. M.O.Eggrolls is kosher certified and supervised by Rabbi Susan Leider. Everything in our Los Angeles food truck is made with kosher and natural ingredients. The M.O.E. menu includes Michael's classic Montreal style chicken eggroll, along with seasonal favorites that will change regularly. Check back for updates each season, and surprise weekly specials from our gourmet food truck!

The word Pokey (pronounced as POH-kay) itself, originated from a Hawaiian verb "Poke" which means "cut piece" or "small piece."  Poke is bite-size pieces of raw fish doused in seasonings. Poke is actually the Hawaiian version of the elegant Japanese sashimi.

We are not just your average sushi truck! 

Just like you, we are food lovers who have been searching for the love at first bite.  We are SLEEK yet ADVENTUROUS with flavors; combining unique - freshest ingredients together to win you over on your first bite! But not only that, imagine gourmet sushi with street price! Ah..... 

Be prepared to fall in love at each bite. 
- The team

restaurant.name: The Bun Truck
restaurant.short_description:
The Bun Truck is a gourmet food truck in the Los Angeles-area serving Korean-Mediterranean Fusion.  The name is derived from our popular steamed buns and Korean BBQ gyros.  Our Chef, James Seok, was trained at the prestigious New York Culinary Institute and has recently worked at New York City’s famed Morimoto Restaurant. 

What originally started out as an idea between two friends who grew up in the Motor City, has now turned into a full-fledged venture.  The Bun Truck represents where we come from, and where we are today: The no-nonsense, gritty city of Detroit, where we're from, and the sunny, laid-back city of Los Angeles, which we've come to love. 

Come try any of our Spicy Pork Gyros, Donkatsu Steamed buns, and Sweet Potato Fries.  Our food is cooked to order and made to perfection using the freshest of ingredients and finest of flavors.

restaurant.name: Lomo Arigato
restaurant.short_description:
Peruvian/Japanese food truck offering fusion street food.

Eric Nakata, a second generation Japanese American, was born and raised in Gardena, CA, the heart of Japanese restaurants. At the early age of 19, he worked for Men Bei, a Japanese restaurant in Torrance. He soon learned what the "restaurant business" was all about. Moving on to working for Kamiyama, he quickly learned how to make sushi. He then worked for Patina at the Hollywood bowl and then ventured to the Dodger Stadium where he introduced sushi to our beloved Dodgers team. Eric has been hired frequently to cater sushi for private parties, birthday parties, special events (including Eliza Dushku's birthday party), the Grammy's after-party, the Disney Concert Hall, as well as the LA Cathedral and Ritz Carlton. He managed to do all this while still working as an executive chef for Kotosh in Lomita for seven years. There he developed a network of admirers who kept coming back for more. 

He was able to save up enough money to begin his dream of becoming the owner of a mobile restaurant where he can share his unique Peruvian and Japanese fusion of cullinary creations. With the support of his family, friends, admirers, combined with his inspirational ideas, Eric is now the owner of Lomo Arigato. The name says it all! It combines "lomo" which is the first part of his main dish called "lomo saltado" with "domo arigato" which means "thank you" in Japanese. Being a pioneer at heart, with his humble, fun loving, and light hearted personality along with his passion for food, Eric Nakata is living his dream at the young age of 27. He's ecstatic to be able to give everyone a taste of his creations, so he hopes you'll all be around to have a try and see how it is yourself!

restaurant.name: Del's
restaurant.short_description:
Del's Los Angeles is bringing Rhode Island's famous Del's soft frozen Italian fruit ice to southern California. Del's fruit ice is made from a secret recipe of filtered water, fruit and sugar. This proven recipe consistently produces a high quality, delicious product.

Del's Lemonade is a time honored and family tradition. Starting in 1840 Italy, great grandfather DeLucia stored snow in caves during the winter insulating it with straw. In the summer months when the lemons are ripe DeLucia would mix the juices from the lemons with the right amount of snow and sugar to create a wonderful and refreshing drink.

Great Grandfather DeLucia made the earliest Del's Frozen Lemonade in 1840, in Naples, Italy. During the winter he carried snow into nearby caves and insulated it with straw. When summer arrived and the local lemons were ripe and flavorful, he mixed their juice with just the right amount of sugar and snow. Thus making a refreshing drink, which he sold at the local market. Fruit ices are popular in Europe, yet none is more loved than the product made from fresh lemon juice. Lemon ices produce the most delicious and thirst-quenching treat.

Grandfather Franco DeLucia brought his father's frozen lemonade recipe to America at the turn of the century. Angelo DeLucia, his son, began work on a machine to produce the frozen lemonade, and on a method of making it a consistently excellent product. In 1948, Del's Frozen Lemonade acquired it's name and became the sole product sold at a little stand in Cranston, Rhode Island. Soon, Angelo had designed the first mobile units in order to serve anywhere in the state.

When Angelo's son, Bruce, entered the family business there were 5 franchises in Rhode Island. Since then, Bruce has made the franchise business flourish and grow. Now, there are many Del's franchises worldwide providing the refreshing, all natural treat to everyone, anywhere, anytime.
Bruce's daughter, Stephanie is now in the family business. She is president of Del's Lemonade's sister company, Francesca Enterprises International. Stephanie also works directly with web sales, promotions and marketing.

restaurant.name: Ice Cream Man
restaurant.short_description:
City: Long Beach

Ice Cream Man's mission is to travel the country, eventually the world, giving away FREE ice cream.

In the summer of 2004, Matt Allen was behind the wheel of a 1969 Chevrolet Step Van, roaming the streets of Ashland, Oregon in search of adventure. Armed with a video camera and an endless supply of frozen treats, he was determined to become not only the most famous ice cream man in Ashland, but the most famous ice cream man in the world. As that summer came to a close, Allen’s mission of entertainment evolved into a greater calling. He began giving away his ice cream for free, starting with an ice cream social for the residents of Ashland and quickly moving to his hometown of Long Beach, California to expand the simple idea of free ice cream into the phenomenon it is today.

restaurant.name: Hungry Nomad
restaurant.short_description:
After 50 years of bringing fresh cuisine to the people through our bakeries, we've decided to take it to the streets.

Hungry Nomad is a mobile spin off of Sasoun Bakery, a family owned and operated Armenian/Lebanese bakery with 8 locations - six in the LA area and two in Lebanon. We have taken our most popular family recipes and given them an edgy and innovative twist for the road. 

Many ask, why Hungry Nomad? Our truck is a traveling nomad without a permanent home, migrating from one location to another with a primary focus of feeding the people. Our truck is also a representation of us as Californians. Our original cuisine is the product of a mix of cultures and flavors that tells the story of our family and how California influenced our palate to create this fusion .

restaurant.name: Don Chow Tacos

Where "Chino meets Latino"

This food truck dishes out fusion tacos and is usually somewhere to be found for late night snacking.

Don Chow Tacos has contributed to reinventing cuisine in the City of Angels – and made it mobile. The savory goodness of our “Chino-meets-Latino” fusion cuisine blends the best of Chinese and Mexican flavors. Kung Pao Chicken Tacos and sweet ‘n’ smoky Chinese BBQ Pork Burritos are just a few menu stand-outs. And we’re especially proud of our Chimales – meat-stuffed masa wrapped in corn husks and steamed. Carne Asada Chow Fun is another popular treat.

restaurant.name: Frozen Crush
restaurant.short_description:
Meet Frozen Crush, LA’s Ultimate Italian Ice Mobile, servicing the Greater Los Angeles area. If you are from the East Coast, your eyes are lighting up as italian ice was your favorite summer treat growing up in New York, Philadelphia, or any of the surrounding areas where italian ice has become the king of all desserts! You may have called it “water ice” back home…or “ice”…or “iceee”…or in our case, a “crush”.

Californians, who are not familiar with italian ice, are always blown away with how silky smooth, flavorful, and refreshing our ices taste. We are told over and over again, that we are far superior to sno cones and shave ice as our italian ices are dairy-free and made with fresh fruit puree, pure cane sugar, and filtered water. We also make sugar-free flavors using Splenda as the sugar substitute. We make our ices in the same machine that makes ice cream – freezing the ingredients while mixing them together. No more watching sticky syrups poured all over chunk or shaved ice which consists mostly of air anyway and ending up with a puddle of liquid at the bottom and crunching on non-flavored ice on top.
We look forward to serving you your 1st Crush!

Frozen Crush can make your upcoming event or party the talk of the town with our Crush Cart. Not only do we make our ice fresh in-house, we can help you choose the best flavors and combos for your specific event. Whether you are planing a birthday party, office or corporate event, tv/movie set refreshment, bar or bat mitzvah, or school party – Frozen Crush would love to be there.

restaurant.name: Pyngle's
restaurant.short_description:
What food do you see around your neighborhood on a daily basis?  Is it healthy, fresh, and sustainable? Food, and how we interact with it, is a habit that is learned over time and passed down from generation to generation.  
 
When we live in a world where the quick and easy fix of the Dollar Menu is on every corner, and one-third of U.S. adults (35.7%)* are obese, it becomes more and more clear that we need to be the ones who affect real change within our communities.
 
Pyngle's mission is clear -- to bring healthy and sustainable eating alternatives to the community.

“The Munchie Machine’s got it all,” adds co-owner and munchie man Oliver Catlin, with a nod, “including attitude and vibe.”

The menu includes grilled sandwiches like the Croque de Munchie with honey-cured ham, choice of cheese, Dijon, mayo with a fried egg on your choice of bread. Hello world !
 
We're Lisa Nativo, Jessica Stambach & Jaclyn Kolsby and we thank you for stopping by our site :)
 
Inspired by our Nonna’s homemade Italian cooking, the next step for Italian Jersey girls with a passion for cooking was inevitable. What began as a dream was brought to life by passion, dedication and creativity, and has unfolded into an amazing company we're proud of. Fueled by decades of friendship, fresh ingredients & the flavors we love, Nonna's Kitchenette (grandma's little kitchen) was born!
 
We're re-inventing Italian food. 100% homemde. With love. Using ONLY the best ingredients. We’ve put a modern twist on nonna’s homemade classic dishes and created unique menu items inspired by flavors we love most. So here we are... best friends, waking up every morning doing something we’ve always loved, together. We're so grateful to be sharing it with the world and thankful for everyone who has become a part of the Nonna’s family. No one ever leaves hungry in our families so, Mangia Mangia! Join us as we take our inner foodies on the road on Food Network's " GREAT FOOD TRUCK RACE, SEASON 3". Tune in Sundays at 9pm. We hope to see you all real soon!
 
To our friends, family and each and everyone of you who continue to support us, THANK YOU.
Xo <3 Lisa, Jessica & Jaclyn
